title: Carlyle Seeks to Mitigate Credit ‘Tail Risk’
sub_head: Pandemic, war and surging inflation elevate risk, Carlyle’s global credit head says
body:
Carlyle Group Inc. is adapting its expanding credit investment strategy to guard against rising risks, particularly from Black Swan-type events that could devastate portfolios.
“There’s greater risk in credit investing today than there was before,” said Mark Jenkins, head of global credit at Carlyle, which had $325 billion in total assets under management at the end of March. “I’m not sure everyone has recognized that.”
